org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.query

Interface QueryManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardQueryManager

    public interface QueryManager
    The QueryManager is responsible for providing access to a number of objects related to queries in a given ChronoDB instance.

    In particular, these objects include the following:

    • QueryParser: The query parser used for parsing QueryTokenStreams
    • QueryOptimizer: The optimizer which is run on every ChronoDBQuery before executing it
    • QueryBuilderStarter: The query builder implementation
    All of the above interfaces require implementations that agree with each other and belong together. The query manager acts as the container and/or factory for these implementation class instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      QueryBuilderStarter createQueryBuilder(ChronoDBTransaction tx)
      Returns a new instance of the QueryBuilderStarter class associated with this query manager.
      QueryBuilderFinalizer createQueryBuilderFinalizer(ChronoDBTransaction tx, ChronoDBQuery query)
      Returns a new instance of the QueryBuilderFinalizer class associated with this query manager.
      QueryOptimizer getQueryOptimizer()
      Returns the QueryOptimizer implementation.
      QueryParser getQueryParser()
      Returns the QueryParser implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • getQueryParser

        QueryParser getQueryParser()
        Returns the QueryParser implementation.

        It is assumed that this method will constantly return the same object (with respect to the == operator).

        Returns:
        The query parser to be used. Never null.

      • getQueryOptimizer

        QueryOptimizer getQueryOptimizer()
        Returns the QueryOptimizer implementation.

        It is assumed that this method will constantly return the same object (with respect to the == operator).

        Returns:
        The query optimizer to be used. Never null.

      • createQueryBuilder

        QueryBuilderStarter createQueryBuilder(ChronoDBTransaction tx)
        Returns a new instance of the QueryBuilderStarter class associated with this query manager.

        This is essentially a factory method for the concrete implementation of QueryBuilderStarter. It must return a new instance on every call.

        Parameters:
        tx - The transaction on which the query is being built. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the query builder implementation.

      • createQueryBuilderFinalizer

        QueryBuilderFinalizer createQueryBuilderFinalizer(ChronoDBTransaction tx,
                                                  ChronoDBQuery query)
        Returns a new instance of the QueryBuilderFinalizer class associated with this query manager.

        This is essentially a factory method for the concrete implementation of QueryBuilderFinalizer. It must return a new instance on every call.

        Parameters:
        tx - The transaction on which the query is being executed. Must not be null.
        query - The query to execute on the transaction. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the query builder finalizer implementation.
